alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lafayette (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lafayette and southwestern Columbia Counties, Webster, western Claiborne and northern Bossier Parishes through 315 AM CDT... At 217 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Springhill, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Minden, Springhill, Homer, Haynesville, Cullen, Plain Dealing, Cotton Valley, Sarepta, Taylor, Dubberly, Dixie Inn, Shongaloo, Welcome, Evergreen, Rocky Mount, Leton, Holly Springs, Spring Lake, Gilark and State Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...and northwestern Louisiana.
